New Records: Messi extended his own record with his 18th assist.
Key Match Events: Lionel Messi's through ball led to Julián Álvarez's goal in the 49th minute
Messi assisted on Lautaro Martínez's goal in the 88th minute
Messi's best scoring chance was in the 65th minute, when Crépeau made a diving stop and Messi's attempt off the rebound was blocked by the head of defender Derek Cornelius
Pre-Game Insights: Canada made its Copa América debut and played its first competitive match under American coach Jesse Marsch, who was hired on May 13.
Messi set a Copa América record by playing in his 35th match, one more than Chile's Sergio Livingstone from 1941 to 1953.
Post-Match Reflections: Argentina players celebrate after scoring a goal against Canada at the Copa América.
Grass was installed at Mercedes-Benz Stadium after a MLS game Saturday on the usual artificial turf.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Argentina started eight players who began the 2022 World Cup final victory over France, inserting central defender Lisandro Martínez, left back Marcos Acuña and Leandro Paredes for Nicolás Otamendi, Nicolás Tagliafico and Enzo Fernández.
Canada captain Alphonso Davies was not content with his side's display against the World Cup champions.
